Comments.Message: Who would use this?
There's no 40dodge version, and the 30dodge item has no stamina on it. When would anyone ever use this?
You'd probably use it in a situation where you weren't concerned about min/maxing your character.  From reading through the Banhammer on EJ, this seems to be a particularly common occurrence.
Those situations are not Rawr's concern.
40Agi+40Stam is way better than 30Dodge.  Miles better.

It can be useful for Anub'arak adds tankers. 
dodge+parry+block+be missed>=100% with high block value.
dodge+parry+block+be missed>=100% with high block value. => can tank 4 adds(Anub'arak 25 Hard) alone.
No.  Just no.  Use the Agi/Stam food and get yourself some more dodge somewhere else.  You'll thank us later.
Anub hard mode doesn't care about stamina.  You need to get 101.x% dodge+parry+block+miss and 3k+ block value.  People run with <30k health and tank it successfully.

To clarify, I think it's a valid approach to consider.  There are situations where I'd rather have 30dodge than 40agi/40sta.  Min/Maxing your avoidance, these give ~0.2% more avoidance than the Agi food (which admittedly is more EH and more threat, it's LESS avoidance).  Basically, it's exactly what is all the rage right now in the War/Pal hardmode tanking community.  If we don't want to support this through "cluttering up the food choices", there should be some other way to model it (options panel?).  Personally, what with all the clutter we already have in the buffs/potions/food panels, what's one more food gonna hurt?

If there's a valid use for this, then we should include it, that's all. I've noticed, however, that in ProtPaladin, Agi is rated higher mitigation than Dodge rating. Based on that, I'd expect that there'd be no use for this food for a ProtPaladin, since their Agi->dodge conversion must be higher than dodge rating->dodge. However, that seems suspect to me, and I'm curious of there's a bug there (like, not applying DR to dodge from Agi?).

http://maintankadin.failsafedesign.com/guides/theorycraft/get-the-hell-out-of-dodge

There's no way 30 Dodge beats 40 Agi, even looking at pure avoidance.  If the Dodge food was still relevant, than it would be worth including, but that simply isn't the case any longer.

Well, the armor contributes to "Mitigation", but not to "Avoidance", which is what we actually care about as an add-tank on Anub.  Sta means nothing, Armor means nothing, if you can't get to 101.8% blocked damage (or whatever the actual percentage is, forget off-hand).

However, after double-checking the numbers, 40agi = 33.6dodge rating.  So yeah, agi food is the better route.  It's gonna be more raw avoidance, as BrWarner said.
What about DKs/Warriors?
(And sidenote, armor very much does matter for anub add tanking)

Yes, armor matters, but being unhittable matters more.  At least, in one gearing strategy.
And I totally forgot that dodge-per-agi is different for pallies and for warriors.  For warriors, Agility is SIGNIFICANTLY worse.  Before DR, 30 dodge rating gives everyone 0.662% dodge.
Before DR, 40agi gives Pallies 0.668% dodge, but only gives warriors 0.472%.  So yes, 30 dodge rating food will give more avoidance than 40agi/40sta would.
Even when factoring in Kings, 44agi is only 0.519% dodge before DR.  30dodge is still 27% stronger
Fair enough; we should include this then, for use by warriors (and probably DKs too?)
I added Dodge Food to my local build and checked it's value, attached screen shot showing that it's at the *bottom* of the food list, even below Spirit food

My mistake - I knew the Agi to Dodge conversion was different for Warriors relative to Paladins, but didn't think it was quite so large off the top of my head, and didn't deem it worth checking further.  Triple-checking the numbers from Whitetooth's Combat Ratings post, using 3.2 numbers, it turns out that 30 Dodge is worth .6630% Dodge, and 40 Agi is worth .5192% Dodge (simply confirming your earlier numbers).  While I personally would still use the Agi food, even if I were to tank all 4 adds (and I do understand the particulars of that role), the Dodge food does technically provide more raw avoidance for Warriors, and should therefore be included within Rawr.
